name: usurer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who lends someone money with the agreement that they will pay back a very much larger amount of money later: Usurers continued to exploit the poor until people could take it no more. Vast fortunes were made by employers and usurers at the expense of small proprietors. See
usury
More examplesFewer examplesThe interest paid by the small farmer to local usurers frequently ranged from 25 to 100 percent.The capital accumulated by the merchants and usurers was originally unproductive. To remove the dependence of small farmers upon local usurers, loan funds were established in many districts.
